Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: xcenter
Argument.Desc: x-location in pixels on datacube where extraction will be made

Argument.Name: ycenter
Argument.Desc: y-location in pixels on datacube where extraction will be made

Argument.Name: highpass
Argument.Desc: highpass filter box size for centroiding

Argument.Name: no_centroid_override
Argument.Desc: Do not centroid on extraction source?

Argument.Name: inner_sky_radius
Argument.Desc: Inner aperture radius at middle wavelength slice (in spaxels i.e. mlens) to extract sky

Argument.Name: outer_sky_radius
Argument.Desc: Outer aperture radius at middle wavelength slice (in spaxels i.e. mlens) to extract sky

Argument.Name: override
Argument.Desc: Override apertures/scaling from spectrophotometric calibration?

Argument.Name: extraction_radius
Argument.Desc: Aperture radius at middle wavelength (in spaxels i.e. mlens) to extract photometry for each wavelength. (only active if Override is set)

Argument.Name: c_ap_scaling
Argument.Desc: Perform aperture scaling with wavelength?

Argument.Name: display
Argument.Desc: -1 = No display; 0 = New (unused) window; else = Window number to display diagnostic plot.

Argument.Name: save_ps_plot
Argument.Desc: Save PostScript of plot?

Argument.Name: write_ascii_file
Argument.Desc: Save ascii file of spectrum (.dat)?

Primitive.Name: Measure locations of Emission Lines

Argument.Name: nlens
Argument.Desc: side length of the lenslet array

Argument.Name: centrXpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate x-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: centrYpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate y-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: w
Argument.Desc: Spectral spacing perpendicular to the dispersion axis at the detcetor in pixel

Argument.Name: P
Argument.Desc: Micro-pupil pattern

Argument.Name: wav_of_centrXYpos
Argument.Desc: 1 if centrX-Ypos is the smallest-wavelength peak of the band; 2 if centrX-Ypos refer to 1.5microns

Argument.Name: maxpos
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum location fluctuation (in pixel) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: maxtilt
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum tilt fluctuation (in degree) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: medfilter
Argument.Desc: 1: Median filtering of dispersion coeff and tilts with a (5x5) median filtering

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitvim_dispgrid
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying image output and wavcal grid overplotted, 0: no display

Argument.Name: tests
Argument.Desc: 1 for extensive tests

Primitive.Name: Flexure 2D x correlation with polcal
Primitive.Comment: This primitive uses the relevent pol cal file to generate a model detector image to cross correlate with a science image and find the flexure offset.

Argument.Desc: How to correct spot shifts due to flexure? [None|Manual|Auto]

Argument.Name: range
Argument.Desc: Range of cross corrleation search in pixels.

Argument.Name: resolution
Argument.Desc: Subpixel resolution of cross correlation

Argument.Name: psf_sep
Argument.Desc: PSF separation in pixels

Argument.Name: stopidl
Argument.Desc: 1: stop IDL, 0: dont stop IDL

Argument.Name: configuration
Argument.Desc: tight=only spots near the psf center, wide=across the field

Argument.Name: x_off
Argument.Desc: initial guess for large offsets

Argument.Name: y_off
Argument.Desc: initial guess for large offsets

Argument.Name: badpix
Argument.Desc: Weight by bad pixel map?

Argument.Name: iterate
Argument.Desc: Take the first result? Or iterate

Argument.Name: max_iter
Argument.Desc: The maximum number of iterations

Argument.Name: manual_dx
Argument.Desc: A pixel shift value. If this is set then no cross-correlation is performed.

Argument.Name: manual_dy
Argument.Desc: A pixel shift value. If this is set then no cross-correlation is performed.

Argument.Name: y_off

Primitive.Name: Simple SDI of post ADI residual
Primitive.Comment: Apply SSDI to create a 2D subtracted image from a cube. Given the user's specified wavelength ranges, extract the 3D datacube slices for each of those wavelength ranges. Collapse these down into 2D images by simply averaging the values at each lenslet (ignoring NANs). Rescale Image1, then compute diffImage = I1scaled - k* I2

Argument.Name: L1Max
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 1, maximum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L2Min
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 2, minimum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L2Max
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 2, maximum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: k
Argument.Desc: Scaling factor of Intensity(wav_range2) with diffImage = I1scaled - k* I2

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display
